message_1: In a study, it was found that 85% of the students who attend math tutorials improve their math scores. If there are 60 students attending math tutorials, how many of them are expected to see an improvement in their math scores?
message_2:
To find the expected number of students who will improve their math scores, we can multiply the total number of students attending the tutorials (60) by the percentage of students who improve their scores (85%).

60 students * 0.85 (85%) = 51 students

So, 51 students are expected to see an improvement in their math scores.
